burlap.oomdp.statehashing

Class SimpleHashableStateFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.oomdp.statehashing.SimpleHashableStateFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HashableStateFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscretizingHashableStateFactory, MaskedHashableStateFactory

    public class SimpleHashableStateFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements HashableStateFactory
    A straightforward factory for creating HashableState objects from State instances. By default, this factory will be object identifier independent (the names of objects don't affect the state definition). However, you can make it object identifier dependent with the either of the constructors SimpleHashableStateFactory(boolean) or SimpleHashableStateFactory(boolean, boolean).

    This factory is capable of hashing states with any kind of values. However, if you wish to hash states that have relational attributes, you must set the factory to be object identifier dependent.

    Optionally, this factory can be set to produce HashableState instances that cache the hash code so that it does not need to be recomputed on multiple calls of the hashCode method. To enable hash code caching, use the SimpleHashableStateFactory(boolean, boolean) constructor. Using caching will use slightly more memory by having to associate an int with each HashableState.

    This class has multiple aspects of the state equality methods implemented so that it can be easily sub classed by other forms of equality checking and have each method override only what it needs to override.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

        protected boolean identifierIndependent

        Whether to cache the hash code for each produced HashableState. Default is non-cached.

        Parameters:
        identifierIndependent - if true then state evaluations are object identifier independent; if false then dependent.
        useCached - if true then the hash code for each produced HashableState will be cached; if false then they will not be cached.
